node.Title: Exploring the possibility of Istio Ingress Gateway
node.Description: Introduction At Mercari, we are using Istio for east-west traffic but we have not used it for north-south traffic. This year, we created a Proof of Concept (PoC) of Istio Ingress Gateway to validate whether it fitted our north-south requirements. Especially, we confirmed the Istio Ingress Gateway and our requirements have a parity. That’s because […]

node.Title: Terraform Plugin Framework Is Now Generally Available
node.Description: The Terraform Plugin Framework 1.0 is now generally available to provide a modern and extensible way for developers to create Terraform providers.

node.Title: Elastic named a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Security Analytics Platforms, Q4 2022
New – Bring ML Models Built Anywhere into Amazon SageMaker Canvas and Generate Predictions
node.Description: Amazon SageMaker Canvas provides business analysts with a visual interface to solve business problems using machine learning (ML) without writing a single line of code. Since we introduced SageMaker Canvas in 2021, many users have asked us for an enhanced, seamless collaboration experience that enables data scientists to share trained models with their business analysts […]

node.Title: Cloudflare achieves FedRAMP authorization to secure more of the public sector
node.Description: Cloudflare for Government expands Cloudflare’s ability to protect and secure the Public Sector

node.Title: Evernote’s Parade of Features, Part Three: Get Things Done on Desktop
node.Description:
Take a deep dive into Evernote on desktop. Learn tips, tricks, & how-tos for getting the most out of Evernote on your desktop or laptop computer.

node.Title: Top takeaways from re:Invent 2022
node.Description: Here are the major announcements at re:Invent that got our attention and some of the things Snyk was up to in Vegas.

node.Title: More bots, more trees
node.Description: Cloudflare’s Bot Fight Mode caught 6x more bots in 2022, and we’re contributing to a new tree planting project in West Bengal.

node.Title: How we’re making Cloudflare’s infrastructure more sustainable
node.Description: Our hardware sustainability initiative encapsulates using hardware components for as long as possible, recycling them responsibly when it is time to decommission them, and selecting the most power-efficient options for our workloads.

node.Title: How we redesigned our offices to be more sustainable
node.Description: As we reimagine how our physical office spaces support the work we do at Cloudflare, sustainable design and operations is at the forefront of our design philosophy and one of the underlying premises that affects all aspects of our workplaces.

node.Title: Historical emissions offsets (and Scope 3 sneak preview)
node.Description: Today, we are excited to announce our first step toward offsetting our historic emissions by investing in 6,060 MTs worth of reforestation carbon offsets as part of the Pacajai Reduction of Emissions from Deforestation and forest Degradation (REDD+) Project in the State of Para, Brazil.

node.Title: A more sustainable end-of-life for your legacy hardware appliances with Cloudflare and Iron Mountain
node.Description: Introduce remarketing and recycling as the more sustainable ways of disposing of your legacy hardware appliances. And announce a partnership with Iron Mountain to make this journey easier and more cost beneficial for Cloudflare customers.

node.Title: Independent report shows: moving to Cloudflare can cut your carbon footprint
node.Description: Preliminary study results find Cloudflare product to be up to 90% more carbon efficient than equivalent on premise hardware.

node.Title: Overview of image similarity search in Elastic
Terminal expands to more countries in Europe
node.Description: Businesses can now accept in-person payments in Switzerland and Norway with Terminal's flexible APIs, SDKs, and pre-certified card readers.

node.Title: Heads-Up: Amazon S3 Security Changes Are Coming in April of 2023
node.Description: Starting in April of 2023 we will be making two changes to Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) to put our latest best practices for bucket security into effect automatically. The changes will begin to go into effect in April and will be rolled out to all AWS Regions within weeks. Once the changes are […]

node.Title: Unsafe deserialization vulnerability in SnakeYaml (CVE-2022-1471)
node.Description: SnakeYaml, a YAML 1.1 parser and emitter for Java, has been reported as vulnerable to CVE-2022-1471, a deserialization vulnerability that can lead to arbitrary code execution.

node.Title: ‘Faster horses’? What to do instead of asking users what they want
node.Description:
‘Faster horses’? What to do instead of asking users what they want I’ve talked to a lot of users, ranging from users of apps to professional services. node.Description:

node.Title: Azure Bicep security fundamentals
node.Description: In those post, we look at Azure Bicep security fundamentals around inputs, outputs, secrets, Key Vault, and more.

node.Title: Creating an accessible search experience with the QueryBuilder component
node.Description: GitHub’s search inputs have several complex accessibility considerations. Let’s dive into what those are, how we addressed them, and talk about the standalone, reusable component that was ultimately built.

node.Title: Ocelot: Scaling observational causal inference at LinkedIn
node.Description: Co-authors: Kenneth Tay and Xiaofeng Wang At Linkedin, we constantly evaluate the value our products and services deliver, so that we can provide the best possible experiences for our members and customers. This includes understanding how product changes impact key metrics related to those experiences. However, simply looking at connections between product changes and key metrics can be misleading. As we know, correlation does not always imply causation. When making decisions about the path forward for a product or feature, we need to know the causal impact of that change on our key […]

node.Title: How Cloudflare helps protect small businesses
node.Description: In this blog, we’ll share new research on how small businesses, including those using our free services, have leveraged Cloudflare services to make their businesses more secure and resistant to disruption.

node.Title: Project Safekeeping – protecting the world’s most vulnerable infrastructure with Zero Trust
node.Description: Cloudflare’s mission is to help make a better Internet. Starting December 13, 2022, we will help support these vulnerable infrastructure by providing our enterprise-level Zero Trust cybersecurity solution to them at no cost, with no time limit.

node.Title: The US government is working on an “Internet for all” plan. We’re on board.
node.Description: The US government has a $65 billion program to get all Americans on the Internet. It’s a great initiative.

node.Title: Cloudflare expands Project Pangea to connect and protect (even) more community networks
node.Description: A year and a half ago, Cloudflare launched Project Pangea to help provide Internet services to underserved communities. Today, we're sharing what we've learned by partnering with community networks, and announcing an expansion of the project.

node.Title: The Montgomery, Alabama Internet Exchange is making the Internet faster. We’re happy to be there.
node.Description: Internet Exchanges are a critical part of a strong Internet. Here’s the story of one of them.
